key_observations: Macro data shows strong positive liquidity signals (US_NET_LIQUIDITY, US_M2_YOY, GLOBAL_M2_USD all POSITIVE)
Credit conditions show mixed signals with both NEGATIVE (HY/IG spreads, Fed funds) and POSITIVE (yield curve) indicators
Volatility indicator (VIX) shows NEGATIVE direction, suggesting low market fear
Price data shows mixed individual asset performance with some gains (ABBV, ABT, ADI) and losses (ACA.PA, ADS.DE)
Regime data indicates strong BULL market with 0.98 confidence
risk_factors: FED_RRP_BALANCE shows NEGATIVE direction, indicating potential liquidity withdrawal
Credit spreads (HY/IG) both show NEGATIVE direction, suggesting credit stress
Fed funds rate NEGATIVE direction indicates restrictive monetary policy
Mixed price action across assets suggests selective rather than broad-based strength
reasoning_summary: Analysis based solely on available macro data and price observations. Strong positive liquidity indicators dominate the macro picture, supporting the BULL regime. However, credit conditions show concerning signals that moderate the fragility assessment. No technical or sentiment data available to corroborate.

D_btc_specific.note: Global regime assessment, not BTC-specific in this cycle
